meanings.definition: Treating all rivals or disputants equally; fair and just.
meanings.sent1: The judge made an impartial decision in the case.
meanings.sent2: It is important for a referee to be impartial during a game.
meanings.sent3: The impartial cat shared its attention equally between two owners.
meanings.sent4: Her impartial nature was like a beacon of fairness in the office.
meanings.sent5: The impartial scales of justice always tip towards what is right.

meanings.sent1: Being impartial means not taking sides in an argument.
meanings.sent2: An impartial review of the evidence is necessary for a fair trial.
meanings.sent3: The impartial weather didn't care if it rained on a picnic or not.
meanings.sent4: His impartial view on politics was refreshing in a heated debate.
meanings.sent5: The impartial mirror reflected everyone's image without judgment.

meanings.sent1: An impartial jury is crucial for a just verdict.
meanings.sent2: The teacher remained impartial when grading all students' work.
meanings.sent3: The impartial vending machine gave out snacks randomly.
meanings.sent4: Her impartial attitude towards all sports teams impressed everyone.
meanings.sent5: The impartial referee called the game without showing any bias.
